sourceMeaningMnemonic: Take your <radical>fingers</radical>, put them on this <radical>turtle shell</radical>, and <kanji>push</kanji> push push! Push the turtle right on out of there.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself using your fingers to push a turtle out of its shell. It really doesn't want to leave, so you have to push really hard.
readingMnemonic: You're trying to <kanji>push</kanji> this turtle out so you can use the shell for your new <reading>o</reading>bi (<ja>お</ja>). You keep seeing other people wearing turtle shell patterns on their obi, but you're going to go a step further. You're going to MAKE your obi out of actual turtle shells! You just have to push this darn turtle out first.
readingInfo: Imagine pushing some turtle shells flat to make a beautiful obi. Wear it out, watch everyone gasp in awe. Oh... oh no! They're trying to push you out of your obi like you did the turtle. They're mad about your turtle crime!
